intro: Cornutia microcalycina, commonly known as the small-calyx cornutia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Cornutia microcalycina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
